Name: Latin Quarter
Ingredients: 35 ml Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior White Rum
35 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
5 ml Lustau San Emilio Pedro Ximénez Sherry
1 dash Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.
History: Swedish Bacardí Legacy 2013 winning cocktail created by Boudy Ghostine at Miss Voon in Stockholm, Sweden. Boudy says, " Two classic drinks that were invented in Cuba inspired me: the Original Daiquiri with Bacardí Carta Blanca and the Cuba Libre with Bacardí Oro . All the ingredients in the cocktail have a connection or a bond with the Latin culture: the rum was originally made in Cuba and is now made now in Puerto Rico; Coca Cola came to Cuba around 1900 and was used to make the Cuba Libre, Mexican or Brazilian lime fruit and finally sherry, a tribute to Don Facundo who was a wine merchant. I present to you the Latin Quarter cocktail, a future classic with a great history behind it. "
Nutrition: One serving of Latin Quarter contains 276 calories
Garnish: Preserved cherry dipped in pop rock sugar
